comment_0: Its about greed, but more than that. Simply put, people don't appreciate what they have and seek other things that they really don't need.
comment_1: People who devote their whole lives to earning money one day realize ("then it all crashes down") that all their money has gotten them nothing worthwhile and they've wasted their entire life in pursuit of money instead of being truly happy and then they realize that they have wasted their life.  (where's your crown, king nothing?)
comment_2: how many people can say this song reminds them of there ex-girlfriend, lol, she was self destructive and thought that she owned all she had, but when she cheated on me everything she had left and her friends left with me because she made them chose between me and her, lol,  to me its not about only money, but the people you surround yourself with the people you influence and stuff, but in the end its all an illusion becuase for people like that loyalty can only be bought and squandered therefore it goes as easily as it came, heh makes me feel good to listen to it, like as my final f**k you, wheres your crown now b*tch? :P
comment_3: The "off to never-never land" bit is an adlib...James making fun of how much King Nothing sounds like Enter Sandman. What I dont know is why Bob Rock left it in on the "squeaky clean" Load production.
comment_4:
I believe it isnt so much about greedy people wanting money, I believe its more about power without responsibility, when someone actually gets something without trying, (Wish I may, Wish I might)
And then when they recieve all this power, they end up failing in the whole resposibility department.....
Come to think of it, kinda like Bush.
Power comes with responsibility is the general Idea, the people who screw over their own countries for themselves, and then go about blaming others. Its about corruption with power, not money. (but I guess their the same thing in some cases)
The video clip supports this
comment_5: I doubt this song was directed at anyone in particular. Rock stars, actors, politicians, lawyers....it's about people who spend their whole lives wishing and working to be the best at material pursuits and not giving anything back to others, and then when their success vanishes, they wonder why they have nothing, because they don't realize or care that they need to give in order to receive.
comment_6: I think that it is about greed, but not necessaily about wanting everything and trying to take all. I see it ass a reference to coporate america and the ceo's and such who see it as their life goal to ammass a great wealth. So what if they are greedy, Thats not what the song is about. Its the fact that these people although are kings in society and socially, are kings of nothing. They have no community, no family, nothing to love, and no one to love them back. They dont donate becuase they want to, if they do only becuase its social protocol. Thats what it means to me. They have everything but they don't know whats important and are kings, but kings of nothing (of actual value)
comment_7: It's about people who are just greedy.  They just need to have everything and they don't care how they get it.
comment_8: I think its about someone who is greedy and they take and take and take, then one day they lose everything because they are so damn greedy...ahh hell i agree with the both of you
comment_9:
hi, i joined this website just to post this.

the reference to the star is a play on the "wishing star" rhyme. it is on the start of Disney's pinocchio.
the exact rhyme is "star light, star bright, first star i see tonight. i wish i may, i wish i might, have this wish i wish tonight."

in this song he wishes he owned the star and wishes he had everything. he uses a wishing star for a wholly selfish reason. i reckon this is supposed to show just how greedy they are.
comment_10:
I heard it was about Axl Rose too. 

And you point your finger, but there's no one around
Just want one thing
Just to play the King
But the castle's crumbled and you're left with just a name

That's AXl Rose all over :D
comment_11: "King" Henrik Lundqvist. JOKING (Excuse The Hockey Pun :). It's obviously about arrogance and greed. I mean just read this line: "...I want that star, I want it now. I want it all and I don't care how." Then you hear the classic phrase: "Be careful what you wish, Be careful what you say, Be careful what you wish you may regret it, be careful what you wish, 'cause you just might get it." Then the chorus line, yatta, yatta, yatta. You get the point. And then at the end you hear James Hetfield say: "...Off to never never land..." That is just a joke by Hetfield because of how similar King Nothing and Enter Sandman sound alike.

comment_21: I think what everybody has said makes sense. the part about the wanting of the star could mean that some people do want everything, even the unattainable, such as stars. comment_23:
It's about political officers more specifically.

"dig for gold, dig for fame, dig to make your name"
they struggle to make themselves famous

"just want one thing, just to play the king"

this means they only want one thing, to become president(play the king, since the president isn't really a king, but holds power), and then the latter parts of the song are about their pasts catching up to them, causing a scandal, and causing their downfall, and all that's left of them is a name.
comment_24: this song kicks ass!!! one of my favorite tallica songs. gotta love it!
comment_25: This song is ace.Not Metallica standard,but still one of the best songs ever written.
comment_26:
"Careful what you wish - you may regret it 
Careful what you wish - you just might get it"

- Well I think these lines says it all. The song is about being careful what you wish, 'cause the grass isn't always greener on the other side. There will always be complications, no matter how perfect a life can seem.

"I want it all, and I don't care how"

- If you say these words, it's bound to go wrong. You have to settle with what you've got, and make the best of it, 'cause things aren't always what they seem.

A great song! I simply love it.
comment_27: i think its basically been said by the people above me but i think its about trying to have it all and build it up to the future, instead of enjoying life. its an awesome song.

comment_29: "he thinks he is in charge. He doesn't respect authority. He's pathetic" aren't those all positive qualities? I mean, everybody should be aware that they are in charge of their own lives and confident about it. And why should anyone respect authority? It is about greed and selfishness.

comment_32: This song is definitley about the Greek Mythology story King Midus(not Mitus). All he wished for is gold and thats all he wanted, he soon got a wish that everything he touched turned to gold. One morning he woke up and went to eat breakfest his food turned to gold and tasted like metal in his mouth. Although his arogance clouded him he continued on to say good morning to his daughter. When he gave her a hug she too turned to gold ceasing her life. His heart was shattered and his life ruined. He soon staved to death because everything he put in his mouth turned to gold.

comment_62:
Well I think this song is about AXL ROSE!
This opinion is mostly based on the line about the castle crumbling and being left with just a name- methinks a reference to Axl legally securing the rights to the name "Guns n roses" just as they were falling apart.

A tenuous interpretation I know, but the Load album did follow that huge tour Metallica did with GnR when Axl was sacking band members left, right and centre so the timing is historically sound!

What do y'alls think? It makes sense to me.

comment_66:
It's about greed, in essence. This song, in the context of James' life, is introspective, in this song James is "King Nothing." James, essentially, is stating that he always wants what he doesn't have, and in the end, this means he has nothing. 
"Wish I may wish I might,
Have this I wish tonight"
James is wishing for something
"Are you satisfied?"
James questioning himself, saying "how much is enough" to himself
the next verse does much the same thing
"Dig for gold, dig for fame,
You dig to make your name"
James saying he wants money, he wants power, he wants to be famous, he craves media attention, this probably was why he was so arrogant during black album era
The chorus does the same thing, but one emphasized line
"Where's your crown king nothing?"
James king where his greed is rooted, or what he's gained, he also says "off to never never land" at the end, this is a reference to this occurring because of the hit success that is the black album, and the song's intentional similarity in order to drive home the point that the black album made him greedy
comment_68: this song is saying that u should know what u are wishing for b/c it might come back to stab you in the back..."careful of what you wish you just might get it"..."and it all crashes down and you break your crown". i can relate to this meaning b/c i have hoped and wished for things and then when it comes...it doesn't come how i wanted it. (not meant to be a greedy saying...b/c we all wish for things for ourselves).
